name: viburnum
content:
Add to word list
Add to word list
a kind of shrub (= bush) or small tree with white or cream flowers in groups, sometimes with a pleasant smell, and small red or dark berries. There are many different types of viburnum: Viburnum fragrans has pale pink scented flowers and grows up to 12 feet tall. The viburnums are useful in the winter garden.
More examplesFewer examplesThe gardens overflow with blue hydrangeas, purple butterfly bushes, orange trumpet vine, lilacs, and viburnum. The evergreen Viburnum tinus has fragrant white flowers with pinkish buds from late winter on.
